com.hdcookbook.grin.features
Class Text

java.lang.Object
  com.hdcookbook.grin.Feature
      com.hdcookbook.grin.features.Text
All Implemented Interfaces:
SetupClient
public class Text
extends Feature

Display text. LIke all features, the upper-left hand corner of the visible text is given.

Author:
Bill Foote (http://jovial.com)

initialize

public void initialize()
Initialize this feature. This is called on show initialization. A show will initialize all of its features after it initializes the phases.

Specified by:
initialize in class Feature

getText

public java.lang.String[] getText()
Get the text that's being displayed.

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String[] newText)
Change the text to display. This should only be called with the show lock held, at an appropriate time in the frame pump loop. A good time to call this is from within a command.

destroy

public void destroy()
Description copied from class: Feature
Free any resources held by this feature. It is the opposite of setup; each call to setup() shall be balanced by a call to unsetup(), and they shall *not* be nested.

It's possible an active phase may be destroyed. For example, the last phase a show is in when the show is destroyed will probably be active (and it will probably be an empty phase too!).

Specified by:
destroy in class Feature
